main event: Civilian radar and military radar picked up an unidentified object about 50 miles south of Minot Air Force Base, North Dakota on April 29, 1964.
interesting points: The object was detected at an altitude of 7,000 feet, appearing to follow the radar target and moving inbound towards the station before disappearing from the scope.
Ground radar picked up the object as a light about 3,000 feet below the radar.
The object was observed both visually and on radar, ruling out propagation anomalies or equipment malfunction.
The object's speed and altitude were compatible with an aircraft, possibly a small private or military aircraft in the area.
The lights observed could be attributed to a civilian aircraft that did not produce a radar return.
result: likely an aircraft, possibly a small private or military aircraft
sighted object: unidentified object detected on radar and observed visually
location: Minot Air Force Base, North Dakota
photographs: yes, the report indicates that photographs were taken
